newsitem.title: USA: Canada spot natgas softens in West, holds in East.
newsitem.headline: Canada spot natgas softens in West, holds in East.

text.p: Canadian spot natural gas prices turned softer Wednesday, as additional field receipts began to arrive in Alberta, market sources said.
"A few more receipts are coming back on the system. Everything is starting to come together," one Calgary-based trader said, referring to the usual convergence in prices at the end of the month.
Spot gas at the AECO storage hub for Thursday delivery eased to about C$1.59-1.60 per gigajoule, down about three cents from Tuesday and off about 13 cents from week-ago levels.
